intro: Pouteria calophylloides, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The tree's most notable feature is its edible, oily seeds, which are encased in a hard, woody shell. It thrives in humid, warm climates with well-drained soil and requires ample sunlight. The plant plays a significant ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various wildlife species and contributing to the biodiversity of the rainforest.
